entries.content: User said "continue" - interpreting this as: proceed with integrating shimmer effect using my best judgment based on existing patterns. Will create modular structure with text rotation, provider-specific colors (orange for Claude, green for Codex), extract JavaScript to separate module, and organize in proper folder structure.

Successfully integrated shimmer text effect into indicator system with complete modular architecture:
- Created CSS files: shimmer-text-base.css, shimmer-text-claude.css (orange), shimmer-text-codex.css (green)
- Created JS modules: ShimmerEffect.js (rotation logic), shimmerTextData.js (provider-specific messages), TextEffectsInitializer.js (lifecycle manager)
- Registered 3 new CSS resources in ResourceManager pipeline (ResourceTypes.ts, ResourceManager.ts, CssUriResolver.ts, base.html)
- Updated both indicator templates with data-shimmer-text attribute
- Wired up initialization in PlaceholderCreator to activate shimmer on placeholder creation
Ready for testing with pnpm build!

ERROR: CSS placeholders not replaced - {{SHIMMER_TEXT_BASE_CSS_URI}} showing literally in HTML. Need to update TemplateInjector to inject these new placeholders. Also JS module 404 error for TextEffectsInitializer.js - browser-side JavaScript can't import from file system paths.

ISSUE: Shimmer gradient animation working but text is invisible. The background-clip: text + text-fill-color: transparent makes the text transparent, so if the gradient isn't positioned correctly or the text color is wrong, text disappears. Need to check CSS.

FIXED: Shimmer text not visible - issue was missing 'shimmer-text' class in HTML templates. CSS selector was `.claude-indicator .shimmer-text` but element only had `.loading-text`. Added `shimmer-text` class directly to both indicator templates so gradient applies immediately.
